ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Get Parent URI that a link was discovered from

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137477665; y=D7DNm0RReND2IPPF7h8ozzkfZULIIaWQdNYCN3gnHwpwFZrCmw
X-Yahoo-Profile: iranitovic

Hello Andrew,

Take a look at
org.archive.crawler.datamodel.CandidateURI.getVia() method.

Note that the 'via' URI itself will not have information about its own 
via URI. Therefore, I don't think that you can have a breadcrumb trail 
that is more than two links long without adding this feature yourself.

There are several ways to add this feature, but maybe the easiest way is 
to write a breadcrumb processor that will utilize the 
CrawlURI/CandidateURI dynamic attributes list (a.k.a aList). The aList 
is a map of key-value pairs for storing information about the URI that 
can be accessed by other processors. This breadcrumb processor can 
maintain the A_BREADCRUMB/List key-value pair where the list can hold 
all URIs visited in the path. Just keep in mind that for big crawls 
carrying over the breadcrumbs might add significant overhead to the 
overall URIs state.

I hope this helps.
i.









> Is there a way to figure out the "parent" URI that the current URI you
> are crawling was discovered from?  I want to create a "breadcrumb" type
> trail of the pages that are crawled and I can't see how this
> relationship can be discovered.  I would like to do this in an
> Extractor, so any help would be great.
> 
> Thanks!
> Andrew
